instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.P3V3S3_EN: What is P3V3S3_EN? P3V3S3_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_S3 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.P1V8S3_PGOOD: What is P1V8S3_PGOOD? P1V8S3_PGOOD is a signal that denotes that the PP1V8_S3 power rail is working..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .
definitions.PPVTTDDR_S3: What is PPVTTDDR_S3? PPVTTDDR_S3 is a 3.3v power rail that powers the DDR RAM when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state. .
definitions.PPV5_S3: What is PPV5_S3? This is a typo of PP5V_S3 When you see PPV5_S3, assume they meant to type PP5V_S3.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.D7105: What is D7105? Diodes between PPDCIN_G3H charger voltage and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, when CHGR_DCIN Is low(less than charger voltage) and PPBUS_G3H is missing this is a critical point to troubleshoot.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
hello, i have Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a that come dead..no water damage, its said that after he connect the mac to projector with HDMI its start to make problem, and after few days it was dead..
i was notice that <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 5V sometimes have and sometimes disappear...i was replace also the charging connector and the same...any idea?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message: Which voltages appear on the board?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL> - 12.5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_3GH</SIGNAL> -3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> -0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0V

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Post <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.2V
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0V( <RESISTOR>R1410</RESISTOR>- ONE SIDE 3.4V FROM <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>)
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> - 3V
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> - 2.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V stable 

i was try SMC baypass dont do nothing..

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 0V"
PCH cannot start power on sequence in this mode.
Do you have original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger???

threads.message:

Multimeter is good enough to see pulsing, or not...

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.

thanks

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
Use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 power pads, instead of power button.
A simple wire to pull <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground; just a temporary contact, of course.
Check signals reaction at same time...

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message: update...when i was try to check pulses after short the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground, the voltage of <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> was 0v without the pulses...after i was disconnect the wire, the fan start , i was put the board back and its turn on,with just charger there is the chaim sound turn on but no fan, just after few min', with battery the fan start immediately,  i was connect all the wires and i was notice that the Touchpad is short, and it didnt turn on again, i was play with reset smc and wait for few min' and it was turn on again with different Touchpad wire...no its stop to turn on again...and dont respond to nothing...i know that if i will play with the board again it will turn on again....i really dont know why...any idea? with reset SMC the fan full speed for 5 sec and dead. can the TouchPad do it?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
13V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>???
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.58v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.433v

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> L 3.4v for few second then 0v

<SIGNAL>PPVCOMP_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> L 3.4v for few second"
Check all S3 voltages at same time.

Also check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> pulses too.

threads.message:
If you get all S3 voltages and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> also goes high (few seconds), check S0 voltages at same time.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> repeatedly and check the reaction on the voltages.

Stable <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
You have correct 1V05 voltage.
Why are you surprised for its boost voltage???
Should be 5v higher, exactly what you've got.

Do you use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger for sure?
Is <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> steady high?

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>:
when <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v  its 1.1v 
0v when <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is missing

Do you use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger for sure?
yes

First, see if board starts with both battery and charger connected.

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> 3.9v"
Always???
Should be if, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is always high (3.4V).

"ppbus 3gh 0.5v"
Now post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Did you make some short between <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins?
Always try to use pins of surrounding components, when you want to measure voltage on a QFN chip...

threads.title: macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> 1-16.5V 2-2.1V"
Burnt, change it.

Don't forget to check diode mode to ground at pin 2/<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; BEFORE applying power to the board.
If too low (as supposed), change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Just in case, remove and check <CAPACITOR>C7105</CAPACITOR> first.
